key_title: Key to the species of Scaevola

Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Goodeniaceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Goodeniaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Goodeniaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Plant a herb or wiry shrub without spines
Plant a woody shrub with simple or forked spines on branchlets; far north-west only
Leaves usually present; stems variously hairy
Leaves reduced to small recurved scales; stems glabrous; far north-west only
Leaves more or less petiolate, flat; calyx-lobes minute or obsolete, much shorter than tube; corolla blue, white or pinkish; peduncles usually less than 2 cm long
Leaves sessile with more or less recurved margins; calyx-lobes 3–5 mm long, longer than tube; corolla violet; peduncles usually more than 2 cm long
Plant procumbent or ascending, never rooting at nodes; flowers subsessile
Plant prostrate, rooting at nodes; flowers shortly pedunculate
Leaves prominently toothed, thin-textured; fruit dry
Leaves more or less entire, thick-textured; fruit succulent, berry-like; coastal sand-dunes
Stems coarsely hispid; lower leaves mostly 5–8 cm long; corolla more than 15 mm long, lilac or bright blue with a yellowish throat; ovary 2-celled
Stems finely appressed-pubescent; all leaves less than 5 cm long; corolla less than 15 mm long, white or pale bluish; ovary 1-celled
